feed.title: NewsTracker: microsoft
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Microsoft joins effort to curb revenge porn
entry.summary: Microsoft announced Wednesday it was joining an effort to curb revenge porn by helping victims remove links to sexually explicit images of them posted without their consent.

entry.title: Microsoft joins effort to curb revenge porn
entry.summary:
"When someone shares intimate images of another person online without that person's consent, the effects can be truly devastating," said Microsoft chief online safety office Jacqueline Beauchere in a blog post.

Beauchere said Microsoft has honoured requests to take down such content, but that it has now established a new reporting page that makes the process easier.

entry.title: Microsoft's hardware strategy under scrutiny after record loss
entry.summary: Microsoft doesn't break out operating margins for its hardware business, but Jefferies & Co analyst John DiFucci told Reuters he believed the Xbox business was at best break-even and that Surface was unprofitable on an operating basis.

entry.title: Microsoft's hardware strategy under scrutiny after record loss
entry.summary:
(Reuters) - Sales of Microsoft Corp's Surface tablets and Xbox gaming consoles are soaring.

Still, Bernstein analyst Mark Moerdler said he didn't expect Microsoft to drop either Surface or Xbox.

entry.title: Technology stocks sink in midday trading after weak showings from Apple, Microsoft and others
entry.summary: Technology shares are leading the way lower on the stock market after Apple and Microsoft turned in disappointing results.

entry.title: Microsoft posts record loss as it writes down Nokia
entry.summary:
Microsoft wants to generate revenue by building search and gaming into the Windows 10 interface, Chief Financial Officer Amy Hood said in April.

Microsoft also took a charge of $940 million related to job cuts announced this month and last year.

entry.title: Microsoft books $8.4 billion write-down on phones in 4Q
entry.summary:
"The Street continues to be wary of what Windows 10 can bring in terms of a growth profile back to the Microsoft story," Ives said.

The decline was exacerbated by a temporary bump last year when Microsoft ended support for Windows XP, which resulted in a one-time boost to Windows 7 sales.

entry.title: Microsoft books $8.4 billion write-down on phones in 4Q
entry.summary: Microsoft plans for Windows 10 to be its last version of Windows before transitioning the business to a fee-for-service model down the road, although how that will work is unclear.

entry.title: Microsoft Books $8.4 Billion Write-Down on Phones in 4Q
Microsoft posts record loss as it writes down Nokia
entry.summary: Sales of Windows to businesses fell 21 percent from the year-earlier quarter, when demand for the operating system had surged after Microsoft discontinued support for Windows XP.

entry.title: Microsoft Posts Largest-Ever Net Loss After Nokia Writedown
entry.summary: The net loss in the fourth quarter, which ended June 30, amounted to $3.2 billion, and sales fell 5.1 percent to $22.2 billion, Microsoft said Tuesday in a statement.

entry.title: Microsoft books $8.4 billion write-down on phones in 4Q
entry.summary: Microsoft booked an $8.4 billion charge in the fourth quarter, swallowing a bitter pill by writing off the Nokia phone business it bought just over a year ago.

entry.title: Microsoft posts quarterly loss, writes down Nokia phone business
entry.summary:
Microsoft reported net income of $4.61 billion US, or 55 cents per share, a year earlier.

Microsoft recorded total impairment, integration and restructuring expenses of $8.4 billion US including the charges related to the Nokia phone business.

entry.title: Microsoft posts $3.2 billion loss as it writes down Nokia phone business
entry.summary:
Microsoft Corp (MSFT.O) reported a $3.2 billion quarterly net loss as it wrote down its Nokia phone business and demand fell for its Windows operating system.

Microsoft said it added 3 million subscribers for Office 365 in the quarter, taking the total number of subscribers for the product to 15.2 million at the end of June.

Microsoft reported a net loss of 40 cents per share for the quarter ended June 30.

entry.title: Miley Cyrus to host MTV Video Music Awards at Microsoft Theater on Aug. 30
entry.summary: The 2015 MTV Video Music Awards will air live on MTV from the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles.

entry.title: Finnish town of Salo hurting as Microsoft shuts Nokia phone unit
entry.summary:
Prime Minister Juha Sipila called Microsoft's decision last week "a big blow," and visited Salo on Monday to hear from locals how the government could best help the town.

Today Salo's unemployment rate stands at 15%, well above the national rate of 9.7%, following the closure of a Nokia factory in 2012 and previous Microsoft layoffs.

Mika Paukkeri, another shop steward, said he hoped Microsoft would cut its staff in Salo, not shut it down altogether.

entry.title: Microsoft deals ‘a big blow’ to Finnish town with Nokia unit closure
entry.summary:
When U.S. software giant Microsoft bought Nokia's struggling mobile phone business last year, the inhabitants of Salo - a town of 54,000 in southern Finland - thought the move would revive the local economy.

But their hopes were crushed last week when Microsoft announced it would close Nokia's former product development unit in the town, putting all 1,100 jobs at risk.

entry.title: In Tech: Comcast games, Microsoft music, HBO online
entry.summary: Along with the new name, Microsoft promises redesigned menus and other new features when it releases Groove with Microsoft's new Windows 10 operating system later this month.

entry.title: In Tech: Comcast games, Microsoft music, HBO online
entry.summary: This screen shot provided by Microsoft shows the Groove Music...

entry.title: In Tech: Comcast games, Microsoft music, HBO online
entry.summary: Microsoft has a streaming music service, too - though it was mostly overlooked as attention turned to Apple's entry into a business crowded with Spotify, Google Play and others.

entry.title: In Tech: Comcast games, Microsoft music, HBO online
entry.summary:
Maybe that's why Microsoft is revamping the service formerly known as Xbox Music.

Like the Xbox Music service, Groove will also offer unlimited streaming from Microsoft's music catalog for $10 a month.

entry.title: Microsoft Office now on multiple devices
entry.summary: Microsoft will sell Office for a one-time payment starting in September.

entry.title: Review: Microsoft Office navigates a world of multiple devices
entry.summary: This product image provided by Microsoft shows Microsoft Word for Mac, part of the new Microsoft Office 2016 Mac suite.

entry.title: Microsoft Office now on multiple devices
entry.summary: The company released Microsoft Office 2016 for Mac on Thursday and new apps for Android phones two weeks ago.

entry.title: Review: Microsoft Office in a world of multiple devices
Review: Microsoft Office in a world of multiple devices
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - Microsoft's new Office apps do a good job of helping us navigate a world in which we frequently switch from one device to another - from a Mac to a Windows PC, with a smartphone or tablet along the way.

Those with an Office 365 subscription can get the Mac Office starting Thursday at http://office.microsoft.com.

entry.title: Microsoft cuts 7,800 jobs as phone sales flag
entry.summary: Analysts have said the Nokia business was a drag on Microsoft's profits.

entry.title: Microsoft cutting 7,800 jobs as phone sales flag
entry.summary:
Three years ago, Microsoft wrote off another big sum, $6.2 billion, on its purchase of digital advertising firm aQuantive.

Microsoft isn't getting out of the hardware business altogether.

entry.title: Microsoft to cut 7,800 jobs as phone sales sag
entry.summary: Microsoft will cut 7,800 jobs and take a US$7.6 billion impairment charge as it attempts to revive its flagging phone hardware business.

entry.title: Microsoft cutting up to 7,800 jobs
entry.summary: Microsoft closed its $7.2 billion deal for Nokia last year.

entry.title: Microsoft to cut up to 7,800 jobs
entry.summary: Microsoft announced plans Wednesday to restructure the company's phone hardware business and to cut up to 7,800 positions.

entry.title: Major Job Cuts Expected at Microsoft
entry.summary:
At the end of March, Microsoft had more than 118,000 employees globally.

Last month, the company said that Stephen Elop, the former chief executive of Nokia who became a senior Microsoft executive after the acquisition, overseeing its devices business, would leave Microsoft.

entry.title: Microsoft plans major job cuts: NYT
entry.summary:
Microsoft Corp, the world's largest software company, plans to announce a new round of layoffs as early as Wednesday as it tries to cut costs further, the New York Times reported.

The layoffs are expected to affect employees at the hardware group and other parts of the company, including the smartphone business that Microsoft acquired from Nokia last year, the newspaper said.

entry.title: Microsoft plans major job cuts: report
entry.summary: The latest job cuts are in addition to the 18,000 jobs Microsoft said it planned to cut a year ago, the newspaper said, citing sources familiar with the matter.

entry.title: Microsoft's Xbox Music Renamed Groove Music in Upcoming Windows 10
entry.summary: But it seems the new Microsoft Groove and Groove Music Pass have nothing to do with Zikera.
